def_cn: 男人;男子
def_en: A man is an adult male human being.

def_cn: 人，人类（此用法仍有争议）
def_en: Man and men are sometimes used to refer to all human beings, including both males and females. Some people dislike this use.

def_cn: （有某类嗜好的）人
def_en: If you say that a man is, for example, a gambling man or an outdoors man, you mean that he likes gambling or outdoor activities.

def_cn: （来自某地的）人；（在某地上过学的）人
def_en: If you say that a man is, for example, a London man or an Oxford man, you mean that he comes from London or Oxford, or went to university there.

def_cn: (某公司或组织的男性)职员，代表
def_en: If you refer to a particular company's or organiza-tion's man, you mean a man who works for or represents that company or organization.

def_cn: (某人的)支持者，亲信
def_en: If you say that a man is someone's man, you mean that he always supports that person or does what they want.

def_cn: 丈夫;情人;男朋友
def_en: Some people refer to a woman's husband, lover, or boyfriend as her man .

def_cn: 士兵（相对于军官而言）
def_en: In the armed forces, the men are soldiers, sailors, marines, or airmen of lower rank, as opposed to the officers.

def_cn: （尤指从事体力劳动或为上级工作的）男工，男雇员，男下属
def_en: Male workers are sometimes referred to as men, especially if they do physical work or work for a more senior person.

def_cn: (对男子的称呼，表示生气或不耐烦)老兄，老弟，小伙子
def_en: One man sometimes addresses another as 'man' when he is angry or impatient with him.

def_cn: （在非正式场合中用以称呼男子）老弟,老兄
def_en: In very informal social situations, man is sometimes used as a greeting or form of address to a man.

def_cn: 在…岗位上工作;操作(机器等)
def_en: If you man something such as a place or machine, you operate it or are in charge of it.
manned; ladies’ man; no-man's land;

def_cn: 有足够的勇气(或能力)
def_en: If you say that a man is man enough to do something, you mean that he has the necessary courage or ability to do it.

def_cn: 更受男人（而非女人）欢迎的男人
def_en: If you describe a man as a man's man, you mean that he has qualities which make him popular with other men rather than with women.

def_cn: 老兄;老弟
def_en: People sometimes address a man as my man .

def_cn: 我的老兄，我的老弟(对地位比自己低的人的友好称呼，但略带屈尊俯就之意)
def_en: people sometimes address a man as my man ,my dear man, or my good man. This form of address is often friendly, but can also suggest that the speaker feels superior to the person being addressed.

def_cn: 能自己做主;无须听命于他人
def_en: If you say that a man is his own man, you approve of the fact that he makes his decisions and his plans himself, and does not depend on other people.

def_cn: 一致;毫无例外
def_en: If you say that a group of men are, do, or think something to a man, you are emphasizing that every one of them is, does, or thinks that thing.

def_cn: 私下的;一对一的;开诚布公的
def_en: A man-to-man conversation or meeting takes place between two men, especially two men who meet to discuss a serious personal matter.
the man in the street→see: street;  man about town→see: town;  man of the world→see: world;
